Haxe Roundup № 349

by Skial Bainn published on Tuesday 22nd December 2015
Suggest a link Correct this issue

Welcome to the latest edition of the Haxe Roundup. Haxe is a high level, strictly typed programming language and cross-compiler.

News from the Community

  • Rewrite opening_hours.js in Haxe.
  • Fadr for Android, Chrome and Web by Tong.

  • Kha Shmup Tutorial Part 5 by Justin Hamilton.
  • Kha Shmup Tutorial Part 6 by Justin Hamilton.
  • Kha Shmup Tutorial Part 7 by Justin Hamilton.

  • haxe-starling 0.4.2 by Pete Shand.

Updates from the Haxe core

22 commits have been made to Haxe in the last week, with 74 commits closed across the Haxe ecosystem.

  • Don’t generate HaxeError unwrapping code when not needed.
  • Fixed reading cmdline arguments of line-breaks and empty strings on Linux.

You can start using the latest features by grabbing a nightly build of Haxe.

I hope everyone has a great Christmas and New Years, I’ll resume the roundups sometime in January!
